title: Voice of the Mirror: Fighting racism in football must be a team effort
text:

Fighting the vile racism staining football must be a team effort with all of us, whatever our background or skin colour, uniting to defeat the bigots.

For too long the game’s ruling bodies ducked their responsibilities, handing out paltry fines and the occasional stadium closure.

But there will be no more slaps on the wrist after England’s match in Bulgaria had to be stopped twice.

UEFA issues points deductions and tournament bans and the prejudiced will soon realise their stupidity is self-defeating, with decent fans demanding the morons be kicked and locked out of grounds.

What happened in Bulgaria wasn’t, alas, unique and we mustn’t ignore the racism Gareth Southgate said his players face here.

The dignity of England’s black stars deserves applause and the contemptible racists should be banned for life from watching football.

But if we’re to save football from racist filth this is a battle for everyone who loves the people’s game. Let’s show racism the red card.

(Image: REUTERS)

Lessons in life

An average of five blade-related incidents every day at schools in England and Wales is five too many.

No one should ever have to fear a knife attack in a classroom, corridor or playground.

When young people with knives is a growing problem the curse is going to infect schools.

Instead of turning them into prisons with regular searches, x-ray machines, CCTV and even guards, why don’t we educate all our kids about why carrying – never mind using – a knife is both dangerous and wrong.

Stopping the young picking up knives is a better way forward than dealing with the bloody results, including the loss of life.

We want our schools to be safe havens.

A star is born

Experts predict we might be only 12 years away from the first birth in space.

In that case, the happy mother and father will have every right to be over the Moon.
description: England's win against Bulgaria was blighted by racist behaviour by the home fans
